I remembered your words that drivers don't perceive motorcycles and bicycles as threats and will continue turning while looking you in the eye... but I perceived the bike as a threat. testimonials.text_en: I was riding about 120 km/h, a truck started turning in front of me (classic), the sun was blinding the driver, plus my speed. But damn, I just calmly braked without panic. A friend riding behind said 'I thought that's it, we're done', although for me it was nothing special. By the way, I train myself to brake only with the front (in ideal conditions), and the day before yesterday I braked only with the front. My point is - you need to train. It's simply a skill that sooner or later will work at the instinct level.
